iv.gloss: the cardinal number that is the sum of three and one
administration of nutrients through a vein

iva.gloss: any of various coarse shrubby plants of the genus Iva with small greenish flowers

iva xanthifolia.gloss: tall annual marsh elder common in moist rich soil in central North America that can cause contact dermatitis

ivan iii.gloss: grand duke of Muscovy whose victories against the Tartars laid the basis for Russian unity (1440-1505)

ivan iii vasilievich.gloss: grand duke of Muscovy whose victories against the Tartars laid the basis for Russian unity (1440-1505)

ivan lendl.gloss: United States tennis player (born in Czechoslovakia) who won several singles championships

ivan pavlov.gloss: Russian physiologist who observed conditioned salivary responses in dogs (1849-1936)

ivan petrovich pavlov.gloss: Russian physiologist who observed conditioned salivary responses in dogs (1849-1936)

ivan sergeevich turgenev.gloss: Russian writer of stories and novels and plays (1818-1883)

ivan the great.gloss: grand duke of Muscovy whose victories against the Tartars laid the basis for Russian unity (1440-1505)

ivan turgenev.gloss: Russian writer of stories and novels and plays (1818-1883)

ives.gloss: United States composer noted for his innovative use of polytonality (1874-1954)
United States lithographer who (with his partner Nathaniel Currier) produced thousands of prints signed `Currier & Ives' (1824-1895)

ivor armstrong richards.gloss: English literary critic who collaborated with C. K. Ogden and contributed to the development of Basic English (1893-1979)

ivory.gloss: a hard smooth ivory colored dentine that makes up most of the tusks of elephants and walruses
a shade of white the color of bleached bones

ivory-billed woodpecker.gloss: large black-and-white woodpecker of southern United States and Cuba having an ivory bill

ivory-nut palm.gloss: a stemless palm tree of Brazil and Peru bearing ivory nuts

ivory coast.gloss: a republic in western Africa on the Gulf of Guinea

ivory coast franc.gloss: the basic unit of money in the Ivory Coast

ivory nut.gloss: nutlike seed of a South American palm

ivory palm.gloss: a stemless palm tree of Brazil and Peru bearing ivory nuts

ivory plant.gloss: a stemless palm tree of Brazil and Peru bearing ivory nuts

ivory tree.gloss: tropical Asian tree with hard white wood and bark formerly used as a remedy for dysentery and diarrhea

ivorybill.gloss: large black-and-white woodpecker of southern United States and Cuba having an ivory bill

ivp.gloss: X-ray picture of the kidneys and ureters after injection of a radiopaque dye
performing pyelography with intravenous injection of a contrast medium

ivry.gloss: a battle (1590) in which the Huguenots under Henry IV defeated the Catholics under the duke of Mayenne

ivry la bataille.gloss: a battle (1590) in which the Huguenots under Henry IV defeated the Catholics under the duke of Mayenne

ivy.gloss: Old World vine with lobed evergreen leaves and black berrylike fruits

ivy-leaved geranium.gloss: a commonly cultivated trailing South American plant with peltate leaves and rosy flowers

ivy arum.gloss: evergreen liana widely cultivated for its variegated foliage

ivy family.gloss: mostly tropical trees and shrubs and lianas: genera Panax and Hedera

ivy geranium.gloss: a commonly cultivated trailing South American plant with peltate leaves and rosy flowers
